cells.data:
$f : A \to B$

One-to-one
(injective)
$\forall a,a' \in A, f(a) = f(a') \implies a = a'$

Onto
(surjective)
$\forall b \in B, \exists a \in A : f(a) = b$

One-to-one correspondence
(Bijection)
Shows that $A$ and $B$ are the same, and shows how to convert from one to the other
It must be injective and surjective

Identity map $\iota$

Inverse
Let $f : A \to B$ be a bijection. The inverse $f^{-1}$ is the function that assigns to each element $b \in B$ the unique $a \in A$ s.t. $f(a) = b$
$f^{-1}(b) = a \iff f(a) = b$

Function composition
$f(g(x)) = (f \circ g)(x)$
Not commutative

Associative
$f \circ (g \circ h) : A \to D = (f \circ g) \circ h : A \to D$

$(f^{-1} \circ f)(a) = a = \iota_A$
$(f \circ f^{-1})(b) = b = \iota_B$

$f \circ i_A = f$
$i_B \circ f = f$

Graphs
$f : A \to B$ has a graph that is $\{ (a,b) : f(a) = b \} \subseteq A \times B$
